===Etymology===
From {{etyl|pt|ja|sort=かっぱ}} {{m|pt|capa||cape; cloak; jacket}},<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> originally referring to the long capes and over-gowns worn by Portuguese [[Jesuit]] [[missionary|missionaries]] in Japan. The kanji are [[ateji]]<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> and were chosen for sound rather than meaning.

Ultimately cognate with {{cog|en|cape}}.
